titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Rope Makers' Benevolent Society of Brooklyn record book 1973.221
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

did.unittitle: Rope Makers' Benevolent Society of Brooklyn record book

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Rope Makers' Benevolent Society of Brooklyn.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Rope Makers' Benevolent Society of Brooklyn was a fraternal organization organized in 1821 and incorporated in 1825. Its aim was to aid widows, orphans, and distressed members. Ropemaking was one of Brooklyn's largest industries in the 19th century.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of one record book containing the printed articles of incorporation and rules and regulations of the Rope Makers' Benevolent Society of Brooklyn, as well as a handwritten roll of members. Also included are a photographic negative and print of a cloth emblem of the Society.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Rope Makers' Benevolent Society of Brooklyn record book, 1973.221, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
